issue.subject: Shop perimeter edit : there is a shift/gap between browser pointer and map
issue.description:
In the map for perimeter edition popup (basket) there may have a "gap" or "shift" between the mouse pointer of the browser, and the effective action in the map.
On most of the cases, the shift is vertical only (Y axis).

!shop_map_gap_shift_in_perimeter_edit.png!

Best way to reproduce is:
* Scroll in basket before editing perimeter, or between two perimeter editions
* OR have a message on top of map (which moves the maps some pixels down), like when selected area is over max 

Sometimes also seen:
* On first edition of perimeter without moving (strange)
* If the browser window is resized (can trigger X+Y shift)

The issue certainly comes from the fact that the MAP is built in a hidden static bootstrap popup.
Reproducible on IE11, Chrome 40 and Firefox 35.

journals.notes:
Problem still came from "fade" effect.
The proposed solution removes fade effect and add "invisible" class on the modal to have it initially hidden.

Thanks you, works like a charm! Unable to reproduce.
Can be closed.
